intro: Acronia valladolidensis, commonly known as the Valladolid acronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Acronia valladolidensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
